comments.body: I think it would be more accurate to say that the values `a[i]` partition the array. The indices themselves are likely to be not unique when there are repeated values.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +654,658 @@    -------
    index_array : ndarray, int
        Array of indices that partition`a` along the specified axis.
        In other words, ``a[index_array]`` yields a sorted `a`.
